title: Error message AttributeError: 'DataFrame' object has no attribute 'ix'
body:
OS: Windows 10
env Anaconda3
DeepLabCut Version 2.1.6.2
Browser Mozilla Firefox

Problem:
I used the DeepLabCut Project Manager GUI. Everything works fine until I try to extract outlier frames. Every time I try this I get the error message AttributeError: 'DataFrame' object has no attribute 'ix'. I already tried to install pandas 0.25.1 (conda install pandas==0.25.1). I also removed the newest version of Anaconda3 from my sytem and installed an older one. But this did not solve the problem. Could you please help me with this? Note that I am an absolute beginner to Anaconda, Python and the whole stuff. 

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1) In [3]: deeplabcut.launch_dlc()
2) in DeepLabCut Project Manager GUI go to Extract outlier frames
3) choose manual for specify the algorithm
4) click Ok
5) in the opening window click grab frames
```

Error Message:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
D:\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\refine_training_dataset\outlier_frame_extraction_toolbox.py in grabFrame(self, event)
    360         else:
    361             self.vid.set(1,self.currFrame)
--> 362             self.chooseFrame()
    363
    364

D:\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\refine_training_dataset\outlier_frame_extraction_toolbox.py in chooseFrame(self)
    320         self.machinefile = os.path.join(str(output_path),'machinelabels-iter'+str(self.iterationindex)+'.h5')
    321         name = str(fname.stem)
--> 322         DF = self.Dataframe.ix[[self.currFrame]]
    323         DF.index=[os.path.join('labeled-data',name,"img"+str(index).zfill(self.strwidth)+".png") for index in DF.index]
    324         img_name = str(output_path) +'/img'+str(self.currFrame).zfill(int(np.ceil(np.log10(self.numberFrames)))) + '.png'

D:\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\generic.py in __getattr__(self, name)
   5272             if self._info_axis._can_hold_identifiers_and_holds_name(name):
   5273                 return self[name]
-> 5274             return object.__getattribute__(self, name)
   5275
   5276     def __setattr__(self, name: str, value) -> None:

AttributeError: 'DataFrame' object has no attribute 'ix'


```
